intro: Hoya finlaysonii, commonly known as the "Floral Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Hoya finlaysonii is a trailing plant that can be grown as a houseplant or in a greenhouse, thriving in bright, indirect light. Its slow growth and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts.
